visa_info: All students are advised to apply for the necessary visa immediately after they received the official offer letter/email from their host university. Some visa application process could take up to 2 months to process. Your exchange at the host university depends on the clearance by the immigration of the host country. Visa is required for a stay of more than 90 days for Singaporean and Malaysians. Non-EU students wishing to study in Poland should apply for an entry visa. All students should legalize their stay exceeding 3 months by obtaining temporary residence permit after their arrival to Poland. More information on http://www.msz.gov.pl
accommodations_info: CUT does not guarantee accommodation to exchange students. Applicants who need accommodation should submit their accommodation application to CUTâ€™s International Relations Office before 30 May, regardless of whether the study period commences in the winter or spring semester of the following academic year. Co-educative student on-campus housing refers to double rooms with shared bathrooms (each bathroom is shared by four students) and shared kitchen. Students may check in our dormitories a few days before the semester starts. Fall Semester: after 16 September, Spring Semester: after 16 February. For more information, please refer to http://iro.pk.edu.pl/accommodation/ and http://www.akademiki.pk.edu.pl/ds4-balon.html (page only in Polish).
